text: The Westward Expansion Trails were wagon roads that settlers used to travel from the eastern United States to California, Oregon and other western parts of the United States during the 19th century. *Santa Fe Trail *Old Spanish Trail *Oregon Trail *California Trail *Mormon Trail *Siskiyou Trail *Southern Emigrant Trail About 500,000 people traveled on these trails and about 50,000 people died. ==Related pages== *Treaty of Guadalupe-Hidalgo *Manifest Destiny *Louisiana Purchase *Gasden Purchase ==References== Category:19th century in the United States Category:Migration Category:Roads
title: Westward Expansion Trails
